---
title: "Get Colors"
---

### Description

Returns the colors of the current color palette.

### Usage

<pre><code class='language-python'>diverging_hcl.colors(n=11, fixup=True, alpha=None,<br/>                     **kwargs)</code></pre>

### Arguments

<dl class="pyp-list param-list">
  <dt style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top">
   <code id="colorspace.palettes.diverging_hcl.colors:n">n</code><code class="argument-class">int</code>
  </dt>
 <dd>escape(Number of colors which should be returned.)</dd>
  <dt style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top">
   <code id="colorspace.palettes.diverging_hcl.colors:fixup">fixup</code><code class="argument-class">None, bool</code>
  </dt>
 <dd>escape(Should sRGB colors be corrected if they lie
outside the defined color space?  If `None` the `fixup`
parameter from the object will be used. Can be set to `True` or
`False` to explicitly control the fixup here.)</dd>
  <dt style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top">
   <code id="colorspace.palettes.diverging_hcl.colors:alpha">alpha</code><code class="argument-class">None, float</code>
  </dt>
 <dd>escape(Float (single value) or vector of floats in the
range of `[0.,1.]` for alpha transparency channel (`0.` means full
transparency, `1.` opaque).  If a single value is provided it will be
applied to all colors, if a vector is given the length has to be `n`.)</dd>
  <dt style = "white-space: nowrap; font-family: monospace; vertical-align: top">
   <code id="colorspace.palettes.diverging_hcl.colors:**kwargs">**kwargs</code>
  </dt>
 <dd>escape(Currently allows for `rev = True` to reverse the colors and
`colorobject = 'anything'` to get HCL colors as return.)</dd>
</dl>
